snippet: Bursts of light and particles like the ones that hit the Earth’s magnetic field on Thursday will soon become a common occurrence.
abstract: Magnetic eruptions on the Sun release two of the largest solar flares over the last five years, accelerating a blob of high-speed particles toward the Earth; flares prompt NASA to issue geomagnetic storm warnings, in turn provoking a series of hyperbolic media reports about possible dangers to air travel and communication systems; storm's impact will likely be limited to satellites and scientific instruments.
lead_paragraph: Bursts of light and particles like the ones that hit the Earth’s magnetic field on Thursday will soon become a common occurrence.

headline.main: Solar Bursts Spray Earth, With More to Come
headline.print_headline: Solar Bursts Spray Earth, With More To Come
